quiz.question: Which Indian festival is popularly called the Festival of Lights?
Which festival marks the Sikh festival of Vaisakhi and also commemorates the formation of the Khalsa?
Which festival custom in Bengal involves married women exchanging sindoor and sweets called 'Sindoor Khela'?
Which festival features street processions and immersed idols in Mumbai as a major civic event?
Which festival involves daughters visiting their parental home after marriage to celebrate with family in some regions?
Which festival marks the Sikh remembrance of Guru Gobind Singh creating the Khalsa in 1699 at Anandpur Sahib?
Which Hindu festival involves married women fasting for their husbands' long life?
Which festival involves the immersion of Ganesha idols into the sea after several days?
Which festival's traditional instrument ensemble in Kerala includes chenda, kombu, and ilathalam?
Which festival in Kerala is renowned for its caparisoned elephants and percussion ensembles?
Which festival in Gujarat is celebrated with nine nights of dancing called Garba and Dandiya Raas?
Which festival's traditional Bengal sweet is 'sandesh', often exchanged during Durga Puja celebrations?
Which festival honors ancestors with shraddha rituals and offerings in many Hindu households?
Which festival marks the onset of spring celebrations and also includes kite flying in parts of India?
Which festival marks the arrival of spring and features 'Lathmar Holi' in certain towns of Uttar Pradesh?
